intro: Hieracium hypochoeroides subsp. romieuxianum, commonly known as the Romieux's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, exhibiting a rosette of basal leaves with hairy surfaces. Its yellow flowers appear in early summer, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific morphological features and geographic distribution.
